messages.body: $TSLA  Sorry, I was too modest here.  Some indication the batteries are still good well past 300k miles.  https://www.teslarati.com/tesla-battery-life-80-percent-capacity-840km-1-million-km/

links.title: Tesla battery predicted to have 80% capacity after 840,000 km (521,000 mi)
links.description: An updated battery study based on crowdsourced data from Model S and Model X owners suggests that Tesla's battery pack will still have 80% capacity after reaching 840,000 kilometers (521,952 miles), or nearly 1 million kilometers driven.

message.body: $TSLA Tesla batteries last 200-300k miles and the motors last 750,000-1,000,000 miles.  This seems quaint:  https://www.consumerreports.org/car-repair-maintenance/make-your-car-last-200-000-miles/

links.title: Make Your Car Last 200,000 Miles
links.description: Many of today's cars last for 200,000 miles or more with few if any major repairs, if properly cared for. Consumer Reports shares its research and advice on how your car can go the distance.

links.title: The Hurricanes, and Climate-Change Questions, Keep Coming. Yes, They're Linked.
links.description: Want climate news in your inbox? Sign up here for Climate Fwd: , our email newsletter. Scientists are increasingly confident of the links between global warming and hurricanes. In a warming world, they say, hurricanes will be stronger, for a simple reason: Warmer water provides more energy that feeds them.

links.title: China auto sales post biggest drop in 7 years as growth engine stalls
links.description: BEIJING (Reuters) - China's car sales fell the most in nearly seven years in September, stoking concerns the world's biggest auto market could contract for the first time in decades this year amid cooling economic growth and a biting trade war.
